messages.message:
i’m not able to run anything in Docker after it’s rebuilt :smiling_face_with_tear: trying to figure out what permissions to add to our Dockerfiles

it doesn’t seem like our build scripts or base images have changed recently? this was working yesterday, so i have no idea what changed

```docker run  -v /Users/serenawang/instabase/webserver/apps-server/tmp/hotconfig:/config \
	--name instabase-apps-server  --env-file /Users/serenawang/instabase/webserver/apps-server/tmp/docker_env_local.list \
	--rm -p 6001:6001 -t -i instabase/apps-server
/bin/bash: start.sh: Permission denied
make: *** [run-docker] Error 126```
after adding some `chmod` commands to the Dockerfile, i’m getting `ModuleNotFoundError`

```docker run  -v /Users/serenawang/instabase/webserver/apps-server/tmp/hotconfig:/config \
	--name instabase-apps-server  --env-file /Users/serenawang/instabase/webserver/apps-server/tmp/docker_env_local.list \
	--rm -p 6001:6001 -t -i instabase/apps-server
Failed to read config file: instabase/shared/gunicorn_hooks_config.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ibuser/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/base.py", line 111, in get_config_from_filename
    spec.loader.exec_module(mod)
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 728, in exec_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 219, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "instabase/shared/gunicorn_hooks_config.py", line 6, in <module>
    from instabase.stats.api import StatsExporter
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'instabase.stats.api'```
this fixed it, but i’m still stumped as to why this broke today
